resources.string: Substratum is an app that takes advantage of Sony\'s Overlay Manager Service (OMS). This is similar to Layers in terms of stability and customization but features such things as no reboots to apply, boot animations, fonts and priority switching.

The Masquerade System is the base of what allows Substratum to run like a Theme Engine. The idea of a masquerade is to simulate the “server/client” technicalities and Substratum communicates with the Masquerade handlers to signal commands directly on the system.
What do I need in order for this to work?
You will need a ROM that has support for the OMS system (ask them, they should know), root access, this app, and a compatible theme (check its Play Store description or ask the developer)
How do I apply a theme?

The application of a theme is a two part process: compilation of the overlays and application of the overlays. If you want to compile and apply in one step, use the Quick Apply tab and choose one or both of the options. If you want to compile then apply, go into the theme, click the Overlay Manager tab, select the overlays and options you want, hit the FAB and choose Compile/Update, then chose those same overlays, and hit Enable Selected.
I\'m bootlooping! How do I fix it?

Delete the file /data/system/overlays.xml in TWRP\'s file manager or adb shell and reboot. Additionally, if you have security set up on your phone, you will need to delete the /data/resource-cache folder.
Some elements look janky after I applied a theme, what happened?
1. Restart SystemUI if it didn\'t do so automatically.\n2. Reboot the phone.\n3. Unapply the overlays, recompile, and reapply.
My overlays did not compile, what happened?
Delete your /system/bin/aapt file and relaunch the application.
Overlays are installed in the /data/app folder, which means each overlay getting its own folder.
